attributes.action: overrule the Coroner & allow the Jean Charles de Menezes inquest jury to consider a verdict of unlawful killing
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The jury at the inquest into the death of Jean Charles de Menezes will not be able to consider a verdict of unlawful killing, the coroner has said. 

Sir Michael Wright said that having heard all the evidence, a verdict of unlawful killing was "not justified".


This decision should be up to the Jury -Unless it is then the coronors court stands open to tha accusation of "whitewash" - this move to ristrict the Jurys options is frankly flies in the face of common conception of the events of this killing.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
